aas:description.aas:langString: Aspect to indicate if there is a return request for a product.

IEC61360:definition.IEC61360:langString: Aspect to indicate if there is a return request for a product.
Represents a boolean value (i.e. a "flag").

Describes a Property which contains the date and time with an optional timezone.

aas:description.aas:langString: Aspect to indicate if there is a return request for a product.
Describes the fact whether a vehicle, assembly or part needs to be returned to requestor.
Describes WHY a vehicle, assembly or part needs to be returned to the requestor and under which conditions.
Describes date when the return request was placed in GMT timezone.
Describes until when the return request is valid in GMT timezone.
Entity encapsulating the conditions the product is in.
Completeness of the product, e.g. missing parts are not acceptable.
Information on whether the product has been dismantled.
Information on mechanical damage to the part, e.g. two broken ribs or part deformation indicate mechanical damage.
Information on whether the product has corrosion.
Information on whether the product has been discoloured.
The request name to be used by the buyer to navigate through the list of demand requests.
The description of the product within the marketplace that might differ from the digital twin.

Specifies the time period when the need exists

The first day of the period
The last day of the period.
Entity encapsulating the min and max value of the range of monetary values.
price of the returned article
The nominal value.
Currency of the price of the return request conform to the ISO4217 in numerical codes.

Depicts if the manufacturer issued a recall (e.g. for security reasons). In concjunction with property needsReturn it can be expressed if the item has to be returned or can directly be destroyed.
